byline.contributor: Tony Iyare reported from Lagos, and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong. Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By TONY IYARE and AUSTIN RAMZY

abstract: Tanker truck explodes on Christmas eve outside industrial plant in rural area of Anambra State, Nigeria, killing dozens of people lined up for fuel to cook holiday meals; accident is latest in series of tanker trunk explosions blamed on country's poor regulation and decrepit infrastructure.
lead_paragraph: The blast occurred as people gathered to buy cooking gas to prepare Christmas meals. The president said “tens of people” were killed, but reporters said the toll was much higher.

headline.main: Gas Tanker in Nigeria Explodes, Killing Dozens
headline.print_headline: Gas Tanker Explodes in Nigeria, Killing Dozens Waiting for Fuel

snippet: The blast occurred as people gathered to buy cooking gas to prepare Christmas meals. The president said “tens of people” were killed, but reporters said the toll was much higher.
